title: A way to specify None as a value for a config variable via env var
body:
This is a continuation of the #1842 which was closed with the "clarification" that empty string as a value for env var is just that - an empty string regardless of what constraints/defaults etc.

But we have not reached a conclusion on how env var could instruct to reset an already set value (e.g. via `datalad -c ` or in some config file) to `None`.

And we already have some "variability" in how we handle `None` among config variables, e.g. some explicitly declare `"none"` to be allowed value, one defaults to `"None"` as a string, and some just set default to `None`:
```shell
$> git grep  -i none datalad/interface/common_cfg.py 
datalad/interface/common_cfg.py:from datalad.support.constraints import EnsureNone
datalad/interface/common_cfg.py:    'datalad.tests.nonetwork': {
datalad/interface/common_cfg.py:        # None keeps the default behavior
datalad/interface/common_cfg.py:        'default': 'None',
datalad/interface/common_cfg.py:        'default': None,
datalad/interface/common_cfg.py:        'default': None,
datalad/interface/common_cfg.py:        'default': None,
datalad/interface/common_cfg.py:        'type': EnsureChoice('tqdm', 'tqdm-ipython', 'log', 'none'),
```
so it seems that the original "motivation" for #1842 is still there: we might want to "straighten out" on either allowed values for config variables with explicit `"none"`, or do provide some special treatment for a value in env var to instruct value to be set to None (well - empty string is a logical choice unless there is `| EnsureStr` or `| EnsureChoice('')`).

Also relates to currently absent analogy for being able to specify `None` in CLI (https://github.com/datalad/datalad/pull/5640) which insofar seems to boil down to deficiency of options specification which we might also want to harmonize a bit or do allow for `None` specification e.g. as proposed by #5640
